009package imagingbook.common.geometry.hulls;
010
011import java.awt.Shape;
012import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Arrays;
015import java.util.List;
016
017import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Vector2D;
018import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.hull.ConvexHull2D;
019import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.hull.MonotoneChain;
020
021import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
022import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
025
026/**
027 * <p>
028 * This class calculate the convex hull of a 2D point set. It is based on the
029 * convex hull implementation provided by the Apache Commons Math library, in
030 * particular classes {@link ConvexHull2D} and {@link MonotoneChain} [1]. See
031 * Sec. 8.4.2 of [2] for additional details.
032 * </p>
033 * <p>
034 * [1] <a href="https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-math/index.html">
035 * https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-math/index.html</a> <br>
036 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
037 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
038 * </p>
039 * 
040 * @author WB
041 * @version 2022/06/24
042 */
043public class ConvexHull implements ShapeProducer {
044        
045        private final ConvexHull2D hull;
046        private final Pnt2d[] vertices;
047        
048        /**
049         * Constructor, creates a {@link ConvexHull} instance from an {@link Iterable}
050         * over {@link Pnt2d}. At least one distinct point is required.
051         * 
052         * @param points an iterator over 2D points
053         */
054        public ConvexHull(Iterable<Pnt2d> points) {
055                if (!points.iterator().hasNext()) {
056                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("empty point sequence, at least one input point required");
057                }
058                List<Vector2D> pts = toVector2D(points);
059                this.hull = new MonotoneChain().generate(pts);
060                Vector2D[] vecs = hull.getVertices();
061                this.vertices = new Pnt2d[vecs.length];
062                for (int i = 0; i < vecs.length; i++) {
063                        vertices[i] = PntDouble.from(vecs[i]);
064                }
065        }
066        
067        /**
068         * Constructor, creates a {@link AxisAlignedBoundingBox} instance from
069         * an array of {@link Pnt2d} points. At least one distinct point is required.
070         * 
071         * @param points an array of 2D points
072         */
073        public ConvexHull(Pnt2d[] points) {
074                this(() -> Arrays.stream(points).iterator());
075        }
076        
077        private static List<Vector2D> toVector2D(Iterable<Pnt2d> points) {
078                List<Vector2D> vecs = new ArrayList<Vector2D>();
079                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
080                        vecs.add(new Vector2D(p.getX(), p.getY()));
081                }
082                return vecs;
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * Returns a sequence of 2D points on the convex hull
087         * (in counter-clockwise order).
088         * 
089         * @return sequence of 2D points on the convex hull
090         */
091        public Pnt2d[] getVertices() {
092                return this.vertices;
093        }
094        
095//      @Deprecated
096//      public Line2D[] getSegments() {
097//              Segment[] origSegments = hull.getLineSegments();
098//              Line2D[] newSegments = new Line2D.Double[origSegments.length];
099//              for (int i = 0; i < origSegments.length; i++) {
100//                      Segment seg = origSegments[i];
101//                      Vector2D start = seg.getStart();
102//                      Vector2D end = seg.getEnd();
103//                      newSegments[i] = new Line2D.Double(start.getX(), start.getY(), end.getX(), end.getY());
104//              }
105//              return newSegments;
106//      }
107        
108        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
109        
110
111
112        @Override
113        public Shape getShape(double scale) {
114                if (vertices.length < 2) {      // degenerate case (single point)
115                        return vertices[0].getShape(scale);
116                }
117                else {
118                        Path2D path = new Path2D.Double(Path2D.WIND_NON_ZERO, 4);
119                        path.moveTo(vertices[0].getX(), vertices[0].getY());
120                        for (int i = 1; i < vertices.length; i++) {
121                                path.lineTo(vertices[i].getX(), vertices[i].getY());
122                        }
123                        path.closePath();
124                        return path;
125                }
126        }
127        
128        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
129        
130        public static final double DefaultContainsTolerance = 1e-12;
131        
132        public boolean contains(Pnt2d p) {
133                return contains(p, DefaultContainsTolerance);
134        }
135        
136        /**
137         * Checks if this convex hull contains the specified point.
138         * This method is used instead of {@link Path2D#contains(double, double)}
139         * to avoid false results due to roundoff errors.
140         * 
141         * @param p some 2D point
142         * @param tolerance positive quantity for being outside
143         * @return true if the point is inside the hull
144         */
145        public boolean contains(Pnt2d p, double tolerance) {
146                for (int i = 0; i < vertices.length; i++) {
147                        int j = (i + 1) % vertices.length;
148                        AlgebraicLine line = AlgebraicLine.from(vertices[i], vertices[j]);
149                        double dist = line.getSignedDistance(p);
150                        // positive signed distance means that the point is to the left
151                        if (dist + tolerance < 0) {
152                                return false;
153                        }
154                }
155                return true;
156        }
157
158}
